intro: Gireoudia schizolepis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with stems that can be upright or prostrate depending on the species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value comes from its vibrant blooms and foliage, which add a touch of elegance to indoor spaces.
